alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 7:56AM EDT until March 25 at 12:55AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 145 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of Duck Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 752 AM EDT, At 730 AM EDT, the automated gauge on Duck Creek at Macksburg indicated the creek level at nearly 12 feet and continuing to rise. Up to 1.5 inches of rainfall has fallen in the Duck Creek Basin this morning with light rain expected to continue through the morning. At 13 feet, Main Street, near the creek, floods. State Route 821, near the intersection with Main Street, begins to flood. Fields adjacent to creek flood. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg and Lower Salem. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
